maml:description.maml:para: Creates a module from PowerShell Crescendo JSON configuration files

This cmdlet exports an object that can be converted into a function that acts as a proxy for a platform specific command. The resultant module file should be executable down to version 5.1 of PowerShell.
The name of the module file you wish to create. You can omit the trailing `.psm1`.
This is a list of JSON files which represent the proxies for the module

By default, if `Export-CrescendoModule` finds an already created module, it will not overwrite the existing file. Use the Force parameter to overwrite the existing file, or remove it prior to running `Export-CrescendoModule`.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
This is a list of JSON files which represent the proxies for the module

By default, if `Export-CrescendoModule` finds an already created module, it will not overwrite the existing file. Use the Force parameter to overwrite the existing file, or remove it prior to running `Export-CrescendoModule`.
The name of the module file you wish to create. You can omit the trailing `.psm1`.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

maml:alert.maml:para: Internally, this function calls the `Import-CommandConfiguration` cmdlet that returns a command object. All files provided in the ConfigurationFile parameter are then used to create each individual function. Finally, all proxies are used to create an `Export-ModuleMember` command invocation, so when the resultant module is imported, the module has all the command proxies available.

maml:description.maml:para: Exports the JSON schema for command configuration as a PowerShell object.
Exports the JSON schema for command configuration as a PowerShell object.
Import a PowerShell Crescendo json file.

This cmdlet exports an object that can be converted into a function that acts as a proxy for the platform specific command. The resultant object may then be used to call a native command that can participate in the PowerShell pipeline. The `ToString` method of the output object returns a string that can be used to create a function that calls the native command. Microsoft Windows, Linux, and macOS can run the generated function, if the native command is on all of the platform.
The json file which represents the command to be wrapped.
The json file which represents the command to be wrapped.

maml:alert.maml:para: The object returned by `Import-CommandConfiguration` is converted through the `ToString` method. Generally, you should use the `Export-CrescendoModule`, which creates a PowerShell `.psm1` file.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
Import-CommandConfiguration ifconfig.crescendo.json
Verb : Invoke Noun : ifconfig OriginalName : ifconfig OriginalCommandElements : Aliases : DefaultParameterSetName : SupportsShouldProcess : False SupportsTransactions : False NoInvocation : False Description : This is a description of the generated function Usage : .SYNOPSIS Run invoke-ifconfig Parameters : {[Parameter()] [string]$Interface = ""} Examples : OriginalText : HelpLinks : OutputHandlers :

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a PowerShell command object.
Creates a PowerShell command object. You can use this object to set the properties of the command you are defining. The resulting object can be converted to JSON to be added to a configuration file.
The verb of the cmdlet you are defining.
The noun of the cmdlet you are defining.
The name of the native command executable to run.
The noun of the cmdlet you are defining.
The name of the native command executable to run.
The verb of the cmdlet you are defining.

command:example.maml:title: --- Example 1 - Create a new command and convert it to JSON ---
command:example.dev:code: PS> New-CrescendoCommand -Verb Get -Noun Something -OriginalName "native.exe" | ConvertTo-Json { "Verb": "Get", "Noun": "Something", "OriginalName": "native.exe", "OriginalCommandElements": null, "Platform": [ "Windows", "Linux", "MacOS" ], "Elevation": null, "Aliases": null, "DefaultParameterSetName": null, "SupportsShouldProcess": false, "ConfirmImpact": null, "SupportsTransactions": false, "NoInvocation": false, "Description": null, "Usage": null, "Parameters": [], "Examples": [], "OriginalText": null, "HelpLinks": null, "OutputHandlers": null, "FunctionName": "Get-Something" }

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a PowerShell object representing an example used in a Crescendo command object.

Creates a PowerShell object representing an example used in a Crescendo command object. The resulting object can be converted to JSON to be inserted into a configuration file or added to a command object coversion to JSON later.
The command line for the example being described.
The original native command that is run for this cmdlet example.
The description of the example.
The command line for the example being described.
The description of the example.
The original native command that is run for this cmdlet example.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS> New-ExampleInfo -command Get-Something -originalCommand native.exe -description 'this is some text' | ConvertTo-Json
{ "Command": "Get-Something", "OriginalCommand": "native.exe", "Description": "this is some text" }

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a PowerShell object representing a Crescendo output handler.

Creates a PowerShell object representing a Crescendo output handler. You can assign values to the properties of the object. The resulting object can be added to the OutputHanders property of a command object or it can be converted to JSON to be inserted in the configuration file.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1 - Create a new output handler object and convert it to JSON
command:example.dev:code:
PS> $outhandler = New-OutputHandler PS> $outhandler.ParameterSetName = 'Default' PS> $outhandler.Handler = 'ParseShadowStorage' PS> $outhandler.HandlerType = 'Function' PS> $outhandler | ConvertTo-Json
{ "ParameterSetName": "Default", "Handler": "ParseShadowStorage", "HandlerType": "Function", "StreamOutput": false }

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a PowerShell object representing a Crescendo Parameter definition.

Creates a PowerShell object representing a Crescendo Parameter definition. You can assign values to the properties of the object. The resulting object can be added to the Parameters property of a command object or it can be converted to JSON to be inserted in the configuration file.
The name of the parameter for the cmdlet being defined.
The original parameter used by the native executable.
The name of the parameter for the cmdlet being defined.
The original parameter used by the native executable.

command:example.maml:title: ---------- Example 1 - Create a new parameter object ----------
command:example.dev:code:
PS> $param = New-ParameterInfo -Name ComputerName -OriginalName '--targethost' PS> $param
Name : ComputerName OriginalName : --targethost OriginalText : Description : DefaultValue : DefaultMissingValue : ApplyToExecutable : False ParameterType : object AdditionalParameterAttributes : Mandatory : False ParameterSetName : Aliases : Position : 2147483647 OriginalPosition : 0 ValueFromPipeline : False ValueFromPipelineByPropertyName : False ValueFromRemainingArguments : False NoGap : False

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a PowerShell object representing a Crescendo Usage definition.

Creates a PowerShell object representing a Crescendo Usage definition. You can assign values to the properties of the object. The resulting object can be added to the Usage property of a command object or it can be converted to JSON to be inserted in the configuration file. The Synopsis of the object is inserted in the module as comment-based help under the `.SYNOPSIS` keyword.
The text describing the purpose of the cmdlet.
The text describing the purpose of the cmdlet.

command:example.maml:title: --- Example 1 - Create a Usage object and convert it to JSON ---
command:example.dev:code:
PS> $usage = New-UsageInfo -usage 'This is a description for how to use the cmdlet.' PS> $usage | ConvertTo-Json
{ "Synopsis": "This is a description for how to use the cmdlet.", "SupportsFlags": false, "HasOptions": false, "OriginalText": null }

maml:description.maml:para: Tests a cmdlet to see if it was created by Crescendo.
Tests a cmdlet to see if it was created by Crescendo.
The name of the cmdlet to test.
The name of the cmdlet to test.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1 - Test various cmdlet to see if they were created by Crescendo
command:example.dev:code:
PS> Test-IsCrescendoCommand Get-Command Test-IsCrescendoCommand: 'Get-Command' is not a function
PS> Test-IsCrescendoCommand Expand-Archive
Module: Microsoft.PowerShell.Archive
Name IsCrescendoCommand RequiresElevation ---- ------------------ ----------------- Expand-Archive False False
PS> Test-IsCrescendoCommand Get-VssProvider
Module: VssAdmin
Name IsCrescendoCommand RequiresElevation ---- ------------------ ----------------- Get-VssProvider True False
